conclusion: To determine how the objects A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the right, above the objects, we need to consider the following:

premise: The light source will move to the right, which means it will be above the objects.

premise: The size of the objects will not change because they are stationary objects.

premise: When the light source moves to the right, above the objects, the objects will move downward and to the left, and the size of the light source will change.
